description: Change of use from office (B1) to restaurant (A3) use at part lower ground and ground floor levels, and 14x residential units (C3) at upper floors and basement; erection of a 6-storey rear extension including remodelling of rear elevation, roof extension to form an additional floor with roof terrace and installation of a new shopfront and entrance door.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the end of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
Condition : 2 - All new external work shall be carried out in materials that resemble, as closely as possible, in colour and texture those of the existing building, unless otherwise specified in the approved application.

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1, EN13 and EN31 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000 and policies S1, S2, B1 and B7 of the Revised Deposit Draft (as amended by the Proposed Modifications agreed by the Council's Executive on 11th January 2006).
Condition : 3 - No persons/customers shall be on the premises in connection with the restaurant (A3) use outside the following times: 07.30 - 23.00 hrs Mondays - Thursdays, 07.30 - 00.00 hours on Fridays, 08.30 - 00.00 on Saturdays and 08.30 - 23.00 hrs on Sundays. 

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policies RE2 and SH18 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000 and policies SD6, R1B and R3 of the Revised Deposit Draft (as amended by the Proposed Modifications agreed by the Council's Executive on 11th January 2006).
Condition : 4 - No music shall be played on the ground floor restaurant (A3 use) premises in such a way as to be audible within the adjoining premises or on the adjoining highway.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policies RE2 and SH18 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000 and policies SD6, R1B and R3 of the Revised Deposit Draft (as amended by the Proposed Modifications agreed by the Council's Executive on 11th January 2006).
Condition : 5 - At 1 metre outside the windows of any neighbouring habitable room the level of noise from all plant and machinery shall be at all times at least 5 decibels below the existing background noise levels, expressed in dB(A) at such locations. Where the noise from the plant and machinery is tonal in character the differences in these levels shall be at least 10 dB(A).

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policies RE2, EN5, EN6 and DS6 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000 and policies SD6, SD7B, SD8 and Appendix 1 of the Revised Deposit Draft (as amended by the Proposed Modifications agreed by the Council's Executive on 11th January 2006).
Condition : 6 - The windows to the rear elevation of the ground floor restaurant hereby approved shall be fixed shut and it shall be permanently retained and maintained as such. 

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policies RE2 and SH18 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000 and policies SD6, R1B and R3 of the Revised Deposit Draft (as amended by the Proposed Modifications agreed by the Council's Executive on 11th January 2006).
Condition : 7 - The development shall not be occupied until a detailed layout of the cycle storage at basement level has been submitted and approved by the Council. Thereafter the area designated as cycle storage space shall be retained and used for no purpose other than for the storage of cycles of the occupiers of the development.

Reason: To ensure that sufficient space is provided for secure cycle storage in accordance with policies TR22 and DS6 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000 and policies T3 and Appendix 6 of the Revised Deposit Draft (as amended by the Proposed Modifications agreed by the Council's Executive on 11th January 2006).
Condition : 8 - Prior to the commencement of the development hereby permitted an accessibility statement (incorporating any changes to the residential layout that may be required) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Thereafter, the development shall be laid out, constructed and maintained in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: To ensure that the residential units meet accessibility standards in compliance with Policy RE3 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000 and to policy H7 of the Revised Deposit Draft as amended by the Proposed Modifications agreed by the Council's Executive on 11th January 2006.
Condition : 9 - The details of the railings to be used to the front elevation of the building shall not be otherwise than as shall have been submitted to and approved by the Council before any work is commenced on the relevant part of the development.  These parts of the development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1, EN13 and EN31 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000 and policies S1, S2, B1 and B7 of the Revised Deposit Draft (as amended by the Proposed Modifications agreed by the Council's Executive on 11th January 2006).
Condition : 10 - Sample panels of the facing brickwork demonstrating the proposed colour, texture, face-bond and pointing shall be provided on site and approved by the Council before the relevant parts of the works are commenced and the development shall be carried out in accordance with the approval given. The sample panel shall be retained on site until the work has been completed.

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1, EN13 and EN31 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000 and policies S1, S2, B1 and B7 of the Revised Deposit Draft (as amended by the Proposed Modifications agreed by the Council's Executive on 11th January 2006).

Condition : 11 - The proposed insulation measures shall be implemented as indicated in the Atkins Acoustic Report January 2006 and thereafter retained and maintained as such.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policies RE2 and SH18 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000 and policies SD6, R1B and R3 of the Revised Deposit Draft (as amended by the Proposed Modifications agreed by the Council's Executive on 11th January 2006).
Condition : 12 - The windows at front ground floor level to the restaurant hereby approved shall not be openable and shall be permanently maintained as such.

Reason: To ensure that the restaurant use does not lead to a noise nuisance that would be likely to be detrimental to the amenities of the future residential occupiers of the upper floors and the amenity of the area in general, in accordance with policies EN1, EN5, SH18 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000, and policies SD6 and R3 of the Revised Deposit Draft, as amended by the Proposed Modifications agreed by the Council's Executive on 11th January 2006.
Condition : 13 - The design of the windows to the rear elevation shall not be otherwise than as shall have been submitted to and approved by the Council before the relevant part of the works is commenced, and the windows shall be provided and permanently maintained in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: To ensure that the impact of the proposed residential use on the visual privacy of existing residential occupiers nearby the site is minimised, in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1 and EN19 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000, and policy SD6 of the Revised Deposit Draft, as amended by the Proposed Modifications agreed by the Council's Executive on 11th January 2006.
